subject: Re: [junit] Running Junit tests with several JREs within another test
msgSnippet: ... Nice expression! I m sure there are bugs lurking in my real code; I m just advocating this approach as a means to isolating them. So, if I have protected
messageBody:
On 14/10/05, Elliotte Harold <elharo@...> wrote:
>
>
> Sounds like the cart's driving your horse to me. Plus you aren't
> actually testing the real code. There could still be bugs hiding in the
> real code you don't know about. :-(
>
>
> --
> Elliotte Rusty Harold elharo@...
> XML in a Nutshell 3rd Edition Just Published!
> http://www.cafeconleche.org/books/xian3/
> http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ISBN=0596007647/cafeaulaitA/ref=nosim
>

Nice expression! I'm sure there are bugs lurking in my real code; I'm just
advocating this approach as a means to isolating them.

So, if I have

protected void exit(int statusCode) {
System.exit(statusCode);
}

in my production code and override just that single method in a testing
subclass, you aren't happy with that solution? Fair enough, so what are your
alternatives?

James


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
